text: Japan Airlines () is the flag carrier of Japan. Its headquarters are in Shinagawa, Tokyo, Japan. The airline and four of its sub-airlines (J-Air, JAL Express, JALways, and Japan Transocean Air) are members of the Oneworld airline alliance. Japan Airlines currently goes to over 90 destinations. ==History== Japan Airlines began on August 1, 1951. In 1954, it started international flights. It bought its first jet aircraft in 1968, the Douglas DC-8. Japan Air System merged with Japan Airlines in 2002. In 2007, it joined the Oneworld alliance. In January 2010, Japan Airlines declared bankruptcy. British Airways and Qantas helped the airline pay off debts. It finally got out of bankruptcy in April 2011. ==Gallery== File:JAL B747-400(JA8077) (4493061571).jpg|Boeing 747-400 File:Japan Airlines, Boeing 787-9 JA861J NRT (19455285040).jpg|Boeing 787-9 File:304ag - JAL - Japan Airlines, MD-11, JA8586@ZRH,30.06.2004 - Flickr - Aero Icarus.jpg|McDonnell Douglas MD-11 ==References== ==Other websites== *JAL website Category:Airlines of Japan Category:1951 establishments in Japan
title: Japan Airlines
